
A careless dev generated RSA keys where both primes are Blum integers. See if you can break it and retrieve the secret flag from this ciphertext: 2275012725139321490862733882481378487173694347263460430726020941971404725180336860910626351540767310200295488200864030221244099638733054443839987325156647


The flag format is flag{...}
n=8916197092690763828458448028091283423000941585719194018947906850341140239637112639055268242583134558023724690597712960404424749595496544577732762448982953, e=242124650183511142634102025988927475723978717357158193742009550629046571082288023279693181490584981032684246433040407877327305861443025292066402694261131
The lower 104 bits of p are: 46051208131691234082280598205887583675


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{mbuop9sw}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2275012725139321490862733882481378487173694347263460430726020941971404725180336860910626351540767310200295488200864030221244099638733054443839987325156647
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8916197092690763828458448028091283423000941585719194018947906850341140239637112639055268242583134558023724690597712960404424749595496544577732762448982953, e=242124650183511142634102025988927475723978717357158193742009550629046571082288023279693181490584981032684246433040407877327305861443025292066402694261131
The lower 104 bits of p are: 46051208131691234082280598205887583675

extra_info: p=81508929140352376901193483434201925841197170885497398015902213807983826212283, q=109389206639406692109546714553755253582163164734370670666586371507721870144491, Ï†(n)=8916197092690763828458448028091283423000941585719194018947906850341140239636921740919488483514123817825736733418289600068804881526814055992417056752626180
